name: Reading the Water
description: The skill of seeing into the surface — reading current, shadow, ripple, and structure to sense where fish dwell.
steps: Observe the flow — fish face into current, waiting for food.
Identify structure: logs, rocks, weeds, docks — all are ambush or rest zones.
Look for ripple disturbances, swirl patterns, and jumping baitfish.
In still water, look for shade lines or subtle depth changes.
Let your eyes and presence settle — seeing takes time.
commonMistakes: Spooking fish by moving too fast or loud.
journalPrompt: What have you overlooked because you rushed to act? How can you see better by being still?
tairoGuidance: The surface speaks — but only to those who stop speaking long enough to hear.
whisper: The water always tells you where it hides its guests — if you learn to listen.
